title: Customs seize large haul of cocaine declared as scrap metal
body_lines: Sri Lanka Customs today seized a 20-foot container with a large haul of cocaine weighing 350kg, worth more than Rs.6,000 million while transiting to India, Customs Deputy Director (Legal) and media spokesman Sudatta Silva said.
He said four containers, including the cocaine container, were loaded into a ship in Panama to reach India via Belgium and Sri Lanka, he said.
"The container was seized following a tip-off received from the customs intelligence unit. The goods in the containers were declared as scrap metal, "he said.
After the customs investigations, the contraband of cocaine was handed over to the Police Narcotic Bureau (PNB), Silva added.
